column1: The person may receive: - Activated charcoal - Airway support, including oxygen, breathing tube through the mouth (intubation), and breathing machine (ventilator) - Blood and urine tests - Chest x-ray - EKG (electrocardiogram, or heart tracing) - Fluids through a vein (IV) - Laxative - Naloxone, a medicine (antidote) to reverse the effect of the poison, many doses may be needed
A large overdose can cause a person to stop breathing and die if medical attention or an antidote is not given right away.
